### Government Tender Announcement:  Supporting the Refinement of Canada-U.S. Electricity Trade Modelling

**Tender Information**
| Category | Details |
| --- | --- |
| Title | Supporting the Refinement of Canada-U.S. Electricity Trade Modelling in a Canadian Electricity Capacity Expansion Model |
| Reference Number | cb-8447-21953400 |
| Amendment Number | 2 |
| Solicitation Number | 5000073843 |
| Tender Closing Date | 2023-09-18T14:00:00 (EST) |
| Contracting Entity | Environment and Climate Change Canada |

**Selection Criteria**
The business proposal will be evaluated based on highest technical merit within a stipulated maximum budget.

**Trade Agreements**
This tender is subject to the following trade agreements:
- Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
- North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
- Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
- Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
- Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
- Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement

**Scope of Work**
The main objective of this tender is to support Environment and Climate Change Canada in including trade with the United States in their NextGrid capacity expansion model. The goal is to:
- Identify and convert existing datasets into simplified representations of the United States in NextGrid
- Integrate market-specific characteristics impacting electricity trade between the U.S. and Canadian provinces
- Propose future scenarios for Canada-U.S. intertie development and energy/capacity contracts
- Support interpretation of the outcomes in NextGrid

**Contact Information**
For further clarification, please contact Samantha Hatzinikou at (873) 500-0150 or samantha.hatzinikou@ec.gc.ca.

**Attachments**
Submissions must be made to the tender notice on the Canada Buys website, accompanied by:
1. Environmental indicators analysis
2. Environmental sciences advisory services
3. Engineering and consulting services for electrical power transmission

Make sure to download and review the complete bid solicitation and attachment before submission.
